function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Seasonal weather conditions influencing the persistence of SARS-CoV-2 in sewer systems","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of COVID-19 status in sewer samples, leading to ineffective public health measures","Mitigation":"Regular monitoring and adjustment of sampling strategies based on seasonal variations","Technologies":"Sewer network modeling, real-time monitoring systems","People":"Population living near sewer systems","Owner":"Public health authorities, wastewater management agencies"},{"Description":"Limitations of wastewater sampling in reflecting the health status of the population","Impact":"Potential misrepresentation of COVID-19 prevalence in specific areas and demographics","Mitigation":"Integration of multiple data sources for a comprehensive view of public health, targeted clinical testing","Technologies":"Wastewater sampling, data analysis tools","People":"Public health researchers, wastewater management agencies","Owner":"Public health authorities, local governments"},{"Description":"Practicability and cost considerations of clinical testing and wastewater-based epidemiology (WBE)","Impact":"Challenges in implementing effective public health measures and monitoring due to resource limitations","Mitigation":"Prioritization of cost-effective strategies, resource allocation based on risk assessment","Technologies":"Cost-effective testing technologies, data analysis tools","People":"Public health authorities, funding agencies","Owner":"Public health authorities, funding agencies"}]}
